description.narrative: To facilitate investments in infrastructure to support mining and downstream processing activities, regardless of funding source, and to build local capacity to prepare and transact infrastructure projects.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement Schedule 2, Section I, Part D, para 1(a) | Description :Carry out the Project in accordancewith the Environmental and Social Management Framework. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, Part A, para 1 | Description :Establish and maintain a ProjectSteering Committee throughout the period of Project implementation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, Part A, para 2 | Description :Establish and maintain a ProjectManagement Unit at the Ministry of Finance throughout the period of Project implementation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, Part A, para 4 | Description :Ministry of Nature, Environment &Tourism will ensure that groundwater management councils and groundwater management administrations have sufficient resources andadequate staffing. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, Part B, para 1 | Description :Prepare Project Implementation Manualincluding Financial Management Manual, and carry out project in accordance with manual agreedwith IDA. | Due Date :01-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, Part A, para 1(a) | Description :Monitor and evaluate progress ofproject and prepare quarterly reports to be submitted within one month of period closing. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, Part B, para 1(a) | Description :Carry out Mid-Term Review and takeall measures required to ensure efficient completion of the project. | Due Date :16-Dec-2013

Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section II, Part C, paras 1-2 | Description :Maintain financial managementsystem and prepare and furnish not later than 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter interim unaudited financial reports. |Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: At least two key infrastructure assets ready for tender

baseline.value: Technical/financial understanding to prepare transactions lacking.

target.value: Two transactions are ready for tendering.

actual.value: Substantially achieved: Preparation of subprojects for investments/transaction is measured through the completion of feasibilityand safeguards studies. Feasibility studies have been completed for three projects: Baganuur mine expansion, Steel Complex andSynthetic Natural Gas (SNG). Safeguards studies for these three subprojects are planned to be completed by the project closingdate, making these three subprojects ready for investments/transaction. Furthermore, the Cumulative Impact Assessment (CIA) forTavan Tolgoi mine supported under MINIS is also planned for completion by the project closing. The feasibility study for the TavanTolgoi mine financed under another Bank supported project has been completed. Thus, by the project closing date, the Tavan TolgoiMine project will also be ready for investments/transaction.

title.narrative: Establishment of 3 RBA in Southern Gobi Region

baseline.value: Insufficient resources/capacity to manage groundwater in Southern Mongolia.

target.value: Building capacity for effective groundwater management.

actual.value: Achieved: The River Basin Adminstrations (RBAs) have been established and adequately staffed; they have become fully operationaland GW management and monitoring plans are in place. Groundwater monitoring wells in south Gobi are completed and equipped.Moreover, the monitoring system is functioning and data is being collected through online telemetry for some remote locations andperiodic downloading from the other installed data loggers.

title.narrative: Good practice and procedures established to prepare projects for public and private financing

baseline.value: Limited understanding of required studies, no guidelines on economic evaluation.

actual.value: Largely achieved: Trainings on preparation of feasibility studies and financial and economic evaluation was delivered to theMinistry of Finance, Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Environment and Tourism, Ministry of Industry and Ministry of Mining. Theconcerned Ministry started to apply best practice on economic evaluation that was shared with them through trainings.

title.narrative: Consultants provide hands-on training and help administer government-financed projects & PPP concessions

target.value: Staff is well trained to administer government-financed projects & PPP concessions

actual.value: Partially achieved: Five training programs were delivered to the Ministry of Finance and other Ministries in the preparation andprocessing of seven PPP transactions since 2011. However due to staff turnover in the Ministries, additional capacity buildingefforts are required.

title.narrative: Promotion of appropriate organization structure for groundwater management established

baseline.value: Preliminary organization structure was in place but not revised

target.value: Development of the appropriate organization structure for the management of the GW in three river basins

actual.value: Achieved: Appropriate organization structure for the management of the GW in three river basins, consisting of 3 RBAs and 3 RBCs,in South Gobi was developed.

baseline.value: Studies for priority projects not available.

target.value: Complete feasibility studies for ongoing infrastructure projects.

actual.value: Achieved: The FS studies for the Baganuur coal mine, Steel Complex and Coal to Gas subprojects have been completed.

title.narrative: Rapid response to address issues impacting private investment

baseline.value: Technical/financial support to address issues not available.

target.value: Rapid response to at least five issues.

actual.value: Achieved: Training on preparation of feasibility studies and financial and economic evaluation was provided to the Ministry ofFinance, Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Environment Green Development and Tourism. Ministry of Industry and Ministry of Mining,regarding the preparation of feasibility studies and financial and economic evaluation. A number of issues concerning needassessment, information gathering, viability of economic analysis, proper preparation and public consultations were addressed inthe course of identifying priority subprojects and the development of the feasibility studies and ESIAs and CIAs.

target.value: At least 5 events over the course of the project.
Develop the fiscal budget plan for the RBAs and RBCs

actual.value: Achieved: The preparation of fiscal budget plans for the RBAs and RBCs, established under the project, has become a norm since 2017.

title.narrative: Improved transparency and public awareness of groundwater resources and the impact of water use and abstraction

actual.value: Completed: more than 3 public awareness workshops were organized between September 17 and 26, 2014. Furthermore, publicconsultations on IWRM plans for 3 RBAs of South Gobi were conducted in October-November 2018.

title.narrative: Agreement to implement important recommendations from water resource pricing studies

baseline.value: Water Resources Pricing studies are finalized

target.value: Water pricing recommendations are well adapted and enforced by the RBAs

actual.value: Achieved: Water resource pricing studies have been completed and recommendations have been implemented by Ministry of Environmentand Tourism and RBAs where volumetric charges have been imposed on water abstractions.
